pages.text: Pharaoh said, “Bring me every knowing sorcerer.”
And when the sorcerers came, Moses said to them, “Cast what you would cast.”
And when they cast, Moses said, “That which you have produced is sorcery; God will soon bring it to naught. Surely God does not allow the deeds of those who work corruption to flourish
God verifies the truth through His Words, though the guilty be averse.”

But none believed in Moses, save some progeny from among his people, for fear of Pharaoh and his notables, that he would oppress them; for truly Pharaoh was exalted in the land, and he was indeed among the prodigal
And Moses said, “O my people! If you believe in God, then trust in Him, if you are submitters.”
And they said, “In God do we trust. Our Lord! Make us not a temptation for the wrongdoing people
And save us through Thy Mercy from disbelieving people.”
And We revealed unto Moses and his brother, “Appoint for thy people houses in Egypt, and make your houses places of worship and perform the prayer, and give glad tidings unto the believers.”

Moses said, “Our Lord! Truly Thou hast given Pharaoh and his notables ornament and wealth in the life of this world, our Lord, so that they may lead astray from Thy way. Our Lord! Blot out their wealth and harden their hearts, so that they will not believe till they see the painful punishment.”
